Posts.Title: M-1 Trial

Posts.Content: I was talking to a friend of mine the other night and came to find he also gad pc. He was diagnosed 5 years and had a RALP followed by radiation the following year. According to him the dr. Said the pc was confined to the prostate and he was cured. He said he had a PSA last week and it came back at 0.2. The Dr. says all is well and still nothing to worry about. My thoughts are if you have had your prostate removed and radiation and you still have a PSA of 0.2 your not really cured and there is still some cancer somewhere. Do you agree or disagree with me on this. I dont want to say something and alarm for no good reason. Ron

Posts.Content: As you may recall I was offered to participate in the M-1 trial by Dr. Chapin at MD Anderson. The purpose of Thur trial is to see if localized treatment in metastatic cancer helps improves life span. I accepted and was randomized today into the group that receives treatment. As you can see from my signature I have local mets of 1 spot on the spine. My options are have my prostate removed by Dr. Chapin or have radiation by the team RO to destroy the leasons in my prostate. This is a difficult decision to make, however I am leaning to removal after ready a report by Dr. Walsh who feels like it is bennifical to temove the primary leason. He thinks it will slow down the spread of mets. Any thoughts or comments on this. Ron

Posts.Title: Semi annual check up

Posts.Content: It was 2 years ago today I found out I had prostate cancer. Its been a tough 2 years as I adjusted to my new normal. The hot flashes, being tired most of the time and waking up with my mouth feeling like I been eating cotton, just to name a few of the new things in my life. However overall I am doing ok. My PSA has been dropping every since I had my surgery in April of 2017. Its currently at 0.1 and it started at 62. My last 2 scans show my tumors have shrunk so the surgery and the lupron are working. I just pray they continue to work for a long time. I want to thank everyone for all the info, prayers and support I have received the past couple years. Kindest Regards, Ron Smith

Posts.Title: What do you think

Posts.Content: I got a call from MDA they want me to come back Feb. 8th and take part in a trial. It is called M1 trial, to see if local treatment of pc that has metastasized will extend the life expectancy of pc patients. They will either radiate or remove the prostate whichever we decide would work best. It is a randomized study so I would have a 50 / 50 chance of treatment at this time. However if the tumers start to grow at anytime they will move you into the treatment side of the study. Any thoughts from any of you longtime pc brothers will be appreciated.
